thread.title: Heartbroken parents of baby killed in Melbourne mall massacre pay tribute to their 'perfect little boy'
thread.title_full: Heartbroken parents of baby killed in Melbourne mall massacre pay tribute to their 'perfect little boy'

author: Patrick Lion
title: Heartbroken parents of baby killed in Melbourne mall massacre pay tribute to their 'perfect little boy'
text:
News Heartbroken parents of baby killed in Melbourne mall massacre pay tribute to their 'perfect little boy' The tribute came as Dimitrious Gargasoulas was today charged with five counts of murder over the drama in the Bourke Street Mail on Friday Share Baby Zachary (right) died but his older sister Zara, 2, (left) is recovering in hospital (Photo: Nawwar Hassan Bryant Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The parents of the baby killed when a car smashed into their pram during last week's Melbourne mall rampage have described the child as a “perfect little baby”. 
Five people died and up to 25 were left injured when a driver allegedly deliberately drove his car at pedestrians and shoppers at the city's Bourke Street mall. 
Matthew and Nawwar Bryant lost three-month-old Zachary in the rampage and the couple are still watching over their other child, Zara, 2, who remains in hospital. 
“Our beautiful Zara is in a stable condition, however, Zachary, our son, did not survive,” Matthew and Nawwar wrote according to Yahoo7 News . Part of the pram after the tragedy on Friday (Photo: REUTERS) Nawwar Hassan Bryant with her partner Matthew and Zara (Photo: Nawwar Hassan Bryant Facebook) 
“He was the most beautiful, loving, happy, and perfect little baby we were so lucky to be gifted with. 
“He was the light of our lives constantly filling our days with smiles and laughs. 
"He leaves us with the best three months and 14 days of wonderful memories spent in this world." Read More People pay their respects at Bourke St Mall in Melbourne today (Photo: Getty) The wreckage of the car on Friday (Photo: REUTERS) Read More First picture of Melbourne mall rampage suspect 'who mowed down and killed four people' posing next to TANK 
The tribute came as Dimitrious Gargasoulas was today charged with five counts of murder over the drama in the Australian city's Bourke Street Mail on Friday. 
He was allegedly the driver who began doing burnouts in the city centre outside Flinder Street Station before driving down the main street, mounting the pavement and knocking people down. 
Gargasoulas was released from hospital this morning and immediately taken for police questioning over the carnage last week. 
But he was not in court as he was said to be unwell to attend. 
The case resumes in August after prosecutors asked for nine months to compile a brief of evidence, citing the “unprecedented nature of the case”. 
Hundreds of mourners gathered in the city's Federation square today. Like us on Facebook
